result.execSummary:
The defendant John P Bulthuis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
No new law violations.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber facility by 06:00 p.m. on 09-19-2014.

supervisions.notes:
Fine ($1,379) to be paid as a Condition of Probation in count 1 of this Case.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Apply 23 days credit.
TIME SERVED.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department.  To be paid as a Condition of Probation in count 1 of this Case.

records.addlTxt:
Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant John P Bulthuis in court with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.

Defendant pleads Guilty to counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 1 & 2.
Counts 3 & 4 are Dismissed as Read-Ins.

Court orders the following:
COUNT 1:
Total Prison:  3.5 Years
Initial Confinement:  1.5  Years
Extended Supervision:  2  Years
Stayed
If Revoked:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
No new law violations.
Mental evaluation and following.

FINE:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a condition of probation.

Condition Time:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Defendant to report to huber by 6:00 p.m. on:  09/19/14 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.



COUNT 2:
30  Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions)
23 Days Credit
Time Served

FINE: $ 1,379.00
DNA Surcharge:   Court Waives.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $ 35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.
To be paid as a condition of probation on count 1.

15 Months D/L REVOCATION
15 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

Atty. Bricco requests the right to expungement.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Court will address at 9/18/14 hearing.
